page.title: 16 Ecology - Animals, Insects
page.content: Due to local factories extending their depots it has resulted in the {squirrels}moving nearer Eastham Woods. There are,at present,150 grey squirrels,although the harsh winter of 1982 killed a large number of the population.They are pests because they steal eggs from nests and they eat the bark off the trees.The wardens cannot kill any of the squirrels because the land is protected. {Partridges}and{hares}have now all disappeared because they ate all the scrub and vegetation. The{bat}population among others has increased during the last 10 years. They live in the hollows of the trees. Bat boxes have been put up to increase the population of the pipestrelle bat. The white-letter Hairstreck {butterfly }has declined in numbers because of the lack of elm leaves.
